timeline.bodyText: Let's not reinvent the wheel, even if the previous way in the back end did. Use this library, for example.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+/**
+ * CSV related utility functions.
+ */
+export class CsvHelper {

replies.bodyText: Those libraries provide high-level conversion between JOSN and CSV but our results CSV generations requires some low-level manipulations. It is worth to try especially for the student list generation.
replies.author: xpdavid
wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText:
This is not a good way. Above all, this adds a tight coupling between front-end testing and back-end testing. Let generateTypes be the only exception for that.
Let's just generate one good test data file to be used by all test cases (I believe it's possible) and put it within this folder (it will be tree-shaken so it won't appear in production).
This will make the second commit obsolete.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: Included generated files instead. I believe the API output would be almost fixed. Let's revise the test file (to a single generic-cover-all test file) in another PR.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: Even though it's done this way before, let's not make this a snapshot test: make this a normal assertion so that we can easily see what the method does.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: Nitpicking, but this line is really too short to be line-broken like this. Same for the one below.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: This has no meaning once the mentioned CSV file is removed. Let's not add this kind of line.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: Choose to leave them there for migration purpose. Will remove them when the branch is ready to be merged.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: On top of having a snapshot file, the old CSV testing makes it such that you can directly open the CSV file to see the content. We lost that ability now, but it's not a big price to pay.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: Based on RFC4180, if the entry contains \r or \n it also needs to be escaped. Let's add that check as well, even though it's unlikely to happen.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,23 @@ + +const LINE_SEPARATOR: string = '\n'; + +/** + * CSV related utility functions. + */ +export class CsvHelper { + + /** + * Converts CSV contents to a standard CSV string. + * + * @param rows list of rows, each row contains elements for each column + * @see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180 + */ + static convertCsvContentsToCsvString(rows: string[][]): string { + return rows.map((columns: string[]) => columns.map((entry: string) => { + if (entry.indexOf(',') >= 0 || entry.indexOf('"') >= 0) {

timeline.bodyText: Based on RFC4180, the line separator is \r\n.
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
wkurniawan07

timeline.message: remove all code relates to result page (including csv generation)
add sample API responses from backend
abstract section type description generation to a pipe
add last name to the session result response output in backend
add framework to generate csv in the frontend
add stats for num scale question
add stats for rank options question
add stats for rank recipients question
